channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description:
@pamela_barone @rdrimmel The Iridium network?

After the initial bankruptcy I believe they re-organized and currently provide service to governments and corporate clients.

(not sure if the first generation of satellites is still active, though)

@Bensade @jonrog1 In fact, being wealthy (or becoming wealthy) is sometimes even seen as reason for not promoting / retaining someone, since they don‚Äôt need they job and thus are much less likely to quietly put up with exploitation or abuse.
item.source:markdown: @Bensade @jonrog1 In fact, being wealthy (or becoming wealthy) is sometimes even seen as reason for ~not~ promoting / retaining someone, since they don‚Äôt ~need~ they job and thus are much less likely to quietly put up with exploitation or abuse.

item.description:
@TSP4Gov Was there a #FRTIB meeting in July?

There are no Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board meeting minutes posted yet for either July 2022 or August 2022: https://t.co/N55OLtZYgz
item.source:markdown:
@TSP4Gov Was there a #FRTIB meeting in July?
There are no Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board meeting minutes posted yet for either July 2022 or August 2022: https://t.co/N55OLtZYgz

item.description:
Irony of the day, courtesy of @nngroup:

Jakob Nielsen‚Äôs March 1999 #Alertbox article extolling #persistentURLs, ‚ÄúURL as UI‚Äù, is no longer accessible at its original URL (https://t.co/c4sm8YIhdd).

To be fair, it did work for over 20 years, which is much better than average!

@NNgroup FYI: Discovered since it is hyperlinked near the end of the ‚ÄúCool URIs don't change" section of @timberners_lee‚Äôs ‚ÄúStyle Guide for online hypertext‚Äù (https://t.co/bwNYfKV9aZ), currently hosted by the @W3C.

(I imagine the old link will start working again by the end of the week)

Note: The #Alertbox article itself is still live and can be read at: https://t.co/g0G7VH0wUJ
item.source:markdown:
Irony of the day, courtesy of @nngroup:
Jakob Nielsen‚Äôs March 1999 #Alertbox article extolling #persistentURLs, ‚ÄúURL as UI‚Äù, is no longer accessible at its original URL (https://t.co/c4sm8YIhdd).
To be fair, it did work for over 20 years, which is ~much~ better than average!
@NNgroup FYI: Discovered since it is hyperlinked near the end of the ‚ÄúCool URIs don't change" section of @timberners_lee‚Äôs ‚ÄúStyle Guide for online hypertext‚Äù (https://t.co/bwNYfKV9aZ), currently hosted by the @W3C.
(I imagine the old link will start working again by the end of the week)
Note: The #Alertbox article itself is still live and can be read at: https://t.co/g0G7VH0wUJ

item.description:
@markproxy @evernote Wait, it‚Äôs 2022 and @Evernote can‚Äôt do that yet?!

- - -

It‚Äôs too bad @ScrivenerApp doesn‚Äôt have an Android version yet (and the workarounds[1][2] don‚Äôt support auto-linking notes).

@SimpleNoteApp does, though.

[1] https://t.co/cAYWtrbpgw [2] https://t.co/tJMssqlDe4

@KayYash6 @1sweetlyfierce1 @allbusch @Angry_Staffer Pretty much.

10 CFR includes most energy-related regulations, except for conservation (18 CFR) and mining (30 CFR).

 - - -

CFR: Title 10. Energy: https://t.co/11aPOhkXzG

@KayYash6 @1sweetlyfierce1 @allbusch @Angry_Staffer Laws regarding energy-related topics seem to be mostly found in various chapters of Title 42 of the United States Code: https://t.co/aJHITbXKOH

(e.g. 42 U.S.C. chapters 14, 23, 24, 71, 73, 74, 81, 83, 84, 91, 93, 94, 96, 98‚Äì101, 125, 134, 149, 152, 161, & 162)
@GorillaMurphy @MuellerSheWrote How did he ‚Äòwork‚Äô out of there for 4 years without someone building an on-site SCIF?
item.source:markdown: @GorillaMurphy @MuellerSheWrote How did he ‚Äòwork‚Äô out of there for 4 years without someone building an on-site SCIF?

item.description: @paulcomp @Adlemig @Tupp_Ed A recent survey found that a significant fraction of younger Americans thought that using a standard aerial antenna to watch live TV broadcasts was a form of #piracy.
item.source:markdown: @paulcomp @Adlemig @Tupp_Ed A recent survey found that a significant fraction of younger Americans thought that using a standard aerial antenna to watch live TV broadcasts was a form of #piracy.

item.description: @DerekL1963 @Casillic It could be manually cleaned (with the cleaning materials placed into the outgoing container) as necessary, and then scanned for surface contamination while still within the glovebox.
item.source:markdown: @DerekL1963 @Casillic It could be manually cleaned (with the cleaning materials placed into the outgoing container) as necessary, and then scanned for surface contamination while still within the glovebox.

item.description:
@1sweetlyfierce1 @allbusch @Angry_Staffer Much of that is considered ‚ÄúRestricted Data‚Äù, under terms of the ‚ÄúAtomic Energy Act of 1954‚Äù (first established under the ‚Äúthe Atomic Energy Act of 1946‚Äù).

https://t.co/DXnRAffRU8

@1sweetlyfierce1 @allbusch @Angry_Staffer See also 10 CFR 1045, ‚ÄúNuclear Classification and Declassification‚Äù

Quick training summary: https://t.co/rexYpAPhDE

@1sweetlyfierce1 @allbusch @Angry_Staffer For those playing along at home, those #RestrictedData definitions refer to the term of art ‚ÄúSpecial Nuclear Material‚Äù.

 - - -

#SpecialNuclearMaterial is separately defined at: https://t.co/9K8vSBVUR3

@CitrineGlitter @Bask1983 @elisabethbraw @PhillipsPOBrien One report claimed it was feed corn intended for raising chickens‚Ä¶ I imagine they have more immediate needs of human-ready grains at the moment.
item.source:markdown: @CitrineGlitter @Bask1983 @elisabethbraw @PhillipsPOBrien One report claimed it was feed corn intended for raising chickens‚Ä¶ I imagine they have more immediate needs of human-ready grains at the moment.
